intro: Stachypitys ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty stachypitys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
